article: I sat in my car waiting in line at the gas station,but my mind was somewhere else completely.It was just a week _ Valentine's Day.Only twentysix months had passed by since my husband Robert Kirk's death,and I couldn't _ thinking about him. Valentine's Day had been twice as _ for me and my husband of fiftytwo years--Robert's birthday was the _ after,February 15th.Every year,on the 14th of February he'd _ me a card,signed at the bottom with "Xs (kisses)" and "Os (hugs)". _ the next day we'd gather with the kids around a birthday cake and blow _ the candles.After all those years,it wasn't _ now to be alone. Suddenly,out of the corner of my _ ,I could see a truck backing up towards me fast.I _ the horn ,but it was too late.Crunch!It had backed up _ into the driver's side of my car.Looking at the _ side view mirror and the platesized dent in the door,I almost felt like crying.I made a claim on my insurance policy and _ ,the claim was pushed through.A week later,I brought my car in for _ and rented one.I drove it home through rainy streets that seemed to _ my feelings. The morning of the 14th,I woke up and still had a feeling of _ .I had to get out of the house.So I headed to the garage.When I got close to it,my eyes were _ on a card on the window of the car.It was signed with "RK",the first letters of Robert Kirk's name;"215",his birthday;and _ for "kisses" and "hugs" that I'd never forget.Who did this? The next day I received a note from my elder daughter, _ "It was a surprise!I just want you to be happy."
